ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry reveals a bilateral, symmetrical, mild-to-moderate gradually sloping sensorineural hearing loss with air and bone conduction thresholds matching, consistent with presbycusis.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, configuration, and type of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds, word recognition scores, and loudness discomfort levels.
To quantify the signal-to-noise ratio loss (QuickSIN) and determine directional microphone needs.
To evaluate middle ear function and check for retrocochlear signs.
To assess communication needs, dexterity issues (arthritis), and self-perceived disability (HHIE, SAC, SOAC).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Evaluation reveals a bilateral mild-to-moderate sloping sensorineural hearing loss with good word recognition in quiet but a significant SNR loss (+7 dB) indicating difficulty in noise. Middle ear function is normal. Dexterity issues due to arthritis and specific lifestyle needs (TV, bridge, gardening) dictate the selection of automated features and accessories.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral mild to moderate gradually sloping SNHL. Right: 20-25 dB HL sloping to 50-55 dB HL. Left: 30 dB HL sloping to 50-60 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs 25 dB HL (Right) and 30 dB HL (Left); WRS 86% (Right) and 82% (Left) at 40 dB SL; LDLs 95 dB HL bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: QuickSIN revealed a 7 dB SNR loss, indicating the need for a +7 dB signal-to-noise ratio to perform like a normal listener.

tests.name: Tympanometry and Reflexes
tests.result_summary: Type A tympanograms bilaterally. Reflexes present at reduced sensation levels (recruitment), no decay.

tests.name: Needs Assessment / Self-Report
tests.result_summary: Completed HHIE, SAC, SOAC, and selection table. Identified dexterity issues (arthritis), need for wind noise management, and desire for TV streaming.

proposed_items: Fit bilateral mini-BTE hearing aids with open domes.
Enable automatic and adaptive directionality, feedback management, and digital noise reduction (DNR).
Utilize Program #4 specifically for wind noise reduction (gardening).
counseling_actions: Counsel on realistic expectations regarding the 7 dB SNR loss and hearing in background noise.
Discuss dexterity strategies for device handling due to arthritis (e.g., remote control vs. automatic features).
Instruct on use of the TV streamer with the patient's son present.
Counsel on phone use strategies (acoustic coupling vs. amplified phone).
Re-instruct on program selection for outdoor/windy environments.

escalation.rationale_short: Routine follow-up for hearing aid fitting, verification, and counseling.

follow_up_plan.objective: Assess adjustment to hearing aids, verify benefit (COSI), and address specific issues with phone use and wind noise.

expected_outcome: Patient reported adjusting well to the new hearing aids and finding them beneficial in most situations.
Difficulty hearing over the phone was resolved by purchasing an amplified telephone similar to the one demonstrated in the clinic.
Wind noise complaint while gardening was addressed by re-instructing the patient to use Program #4.
COSI documentation confirmed improvement in targeted areas, including hearing the television with the streamer.
